headline: Walmart FTC Settlement Reshapes Driver Pay Transparency And Delivery Economics
summary: Walmart (NasdaqGS:WMT) agreed to a $100 million settlement with the Federal Trade Commission and 11 states. The case centers on allegations that Walmart misled delivery drivers about pay and tips in its driver program. The settlement includes new oversight measures intended to increase transparency and fairness in driver compensation. For you as an investor following Walmart, this development touches a core part of its delivery and e commerce services that sit alongside its large brick and...

headline: Walmart to pay $100M to settle claims it misled delivery drivers
summary: Michigan drivers will receive at least $890,000 as part of the FTC-led settlement, which says Walmart misrepresented Spark Driver pay and tips.

headline: How to Fight AI? The ‘Rolex Effect’ Could Lift Apple and Other Consumer Brands
summary: Swiss watchmakers survived the quartz revolution. Now strategists say Apple, Coca-Cola, and other top consumer brands could prove resilient against AI disruption thanks to strong emotional loyalty.

headline: Mama’s Creations price target raised to $24 from $20 at Maxim
summary: Maxim raised the firm’s price target on Mama‘s Creations (MAMA) to $24 from $20 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The firm’s Investor Day has detailed recent progress around new SKUs at Walmart and its first Costco Everyday Item, the analyst tells investors in a research note. Mama’s Creations has developed a pipeline of M&A opportunities focused on incremental customers, distribution footprint diversification, and new product categories, the firm adds.Claim 50% Off TipRanks PremiumUnlock he

headline: Target to stop selling cereals with certified synthetic colors by end of May
summary: Target will stop selling its entire assortment of cereal with certified synthetic colors by the end of May.  The move, announced Friday, underscores the acknowledgment that American consumers and the U.S. government under President Donald Trump are paying attention to what goes into packaged foods.  The Minneapolis-based discounter said it had been phasing out synthetic colors in cereals for several years, and currently nearly 85% of its cereal sales already come from products made without certified synthetic dyes.

headline: Walmart exec says the U.S. needs to get tougher on training its next generation of workers in AI: ‘Look at China, 5-year-olds are learning DeepSeek’
summary: As AI threatens white-collar work, the U.S. should learn from China’s tech training for children, Walmart’s chief people officer Donna Morris said.

headline: Walmart To Pay $100 Million To Settle FTC Claims Over Deceptive Delivery Driver Pay Practices
summary: Walmart (NYSE: WMT), has consented to a $100 million settlement following accusations of misleading its delivery drivers about their compensation, causing substantial income loss.

raw.headline: Walmart To Pay $100 Million To Settle FTC Claims Over Deceptive Delivery Driver Pay Practices
